unnormalised: The air in Kota hung thick with anticipation, much like the monsoon clouds gathering overhead in July. It was the start of another academic year, and for thousands of students like Rohan, it marked the beginning of a grueling journey toward cracking the IIT-JEE. Rohan, fresh out of DPS Delhi with a respectable 92% in his Class 10 boards, felt a mix of excitement and trepidation as he entered the gates of "Resonance Coaching Centre," one of the biggest names in the business.
normalised: The air in Kota hung thick with anticipation, much like the monsoon clouds gathering overhead in July. It was the start of another academic year, and for thousands of students like Rohan, it marked the beginning of a grueling journey toward cracking the I-I-T J-E-E. Rohan, fresh out of D-P-S Delhi with a respectable ninety two percent in his Class ten boards, felt a mix of excitement and trepidation as he entered the gates of "Resonance Coaching Centre," one of the biggest names in the business.

unnormalised: His parents had invested a significant portion of their savings – around Rs. 2.5 lakh – in his two-year coaching program. They believed, like many others, that Kota was the ultimate launchpad for a successful engineering career. Rohan clutched his new backpack, stuffed with study materials and the hopes of his family. He remembered his grandfather’s words: “Beta, IIT is the golden ticket.”
normalised: His parents had invested a significant portion of their savings – around rupee two point five lakh – in his two-year coaching program. They believed, like many others, that Kota was the ultimate launchpad for a successful engineering career. Rohan clutched his new backpack, stuffed with study materials and the hopes of his family. He remembered his grandfather’s words: “Beta, I-I-T is the golden ticket.”

unnormalised: The initial weeks were a whirlwind of lectures, practice tests, and late-night study sessions. Physics by Mr. Sharma was particularly challenging. The sheer volume of information was overwhelming. Rohan quickly realized that scoring well in school was vastly different from competing with the nation’s brightest minds. Regular mock tests were conducted, with the results prominently displayed. Rohan’s initial scores hovered around 60%, a far cry from the 90+% he was used to.
normalised: The initial weeks were a whirlwind of lectures, practice tests, and late-night study sessions. Physics by Mister Sharma was particularly challenging. The sheer volume of information was overwhelming. Rohan quickly realized that scoring well in school was vastly different from competing with the nation’s brightest minds. Regular mock tests were conducted, with the results prominently displayed. Rohan’s initial scores hovered around sixty percent, a far cry from the ninety plus percent he was used to.

unnormalised: Slowly, the pressure began to mount. The coaching center instilled a rigorous schedule, leaving little room for anything else. Students were expected to attend classes from 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM, followed by doubt-clearing sessions and self-study until late into the night. Sunday was reserved for full-length practice exams, simulating the actual JEE experience. Rohan started relying heavily on chai and copious amounts of coffee to keep himself awake.
normalised: Slowly, the pressure began to mount. The coaching center instilled a rigorous schedule, leaving little room for anything else. Students were expected to attend classes from eight zero zero A-M to two zero zero P-M, followed by doubt-clearing sessions and self-study until late into the night. Sunday was reserved for full-length practice exams, simulating the actual J-E-E experience. Rohan started relying heavily on chai and copious amounts of coffee to keep himself awake.

unnormalised: The competition was fierce. Rohan’s classmates, many of whom had been preparing since Class 9, seemed to possess an almost superhuman ability to solve complex problems. He felt inadequate, questioning his abilities and his decision to come to Kota. One evening, after scoring a dismal 45% on a particularly difficult physics test, Rohan called his mother, his voice choked with emotion. She reassured him, reminding him of his potential and urging him to persevere.
normalised: The competition was fierce. Rohan’s classmates, many of whom had been preparing since Class nine, seemed to possess an almost superhuman ability to solve complex problems. He felt inadequate, questioning his abilities and his decision to come to Kota. One evening, after scoring a dismal forty five percent on a particularly difficult physics test, Rohan called his mother, his voice choked with emotion. She reassured him, reminding him of his potential and urging him to persevere.

unnormalised: Midway through the first year, Rohan discovered online resources – particularly YouTube channels specializing in JEE preparation. These resources offered alternative explanations and problem-solving techniques that complemented the coaching center's curriculum. He started attending extra classes at "Vidyamandir Classes" on weekends to get more practice. He learned to manage his time effectively and sought help from his teachers whenever he struggled with a concept.
normalised: Midway through the first year, Rohan discovered online resources – particularly YouTube channels specializing in J-E-E preparation. These resources offered alternative explanations and problem-solving techniques that complemented the coaching center's curriculum. He started attending extra classes at "Vidyamandir Classes" on weekends to get more practice. He learned to manage his time effectively and sought help from his teachers whenever he struggled with a concept.

unnormalised: By the end of the two-year program, Rohan had transformed. He was no longer the nervous, overwhelmed student who had first arrived in Kota. He had developed a strong foundation in physics, chemistry, and mathematics, and more importantly, he had learned the value of hard work, perseverance, and resilience. On 25/05/2026, when the JEE results were announced, Rohan secured a rank of 3500, securing him a seat in IIT Guwahati. His grandfather's words echoed in his mind once again, but this time, they were filled with the sweet taste of success. He knew the journey had been tough, but it had also been transformative. The 2.5 years in Kota had shaped him in ways he couldn't have imagined.
normalised: By the end of the two-year program, Rohan had transformed. He was no longer the nervous, overwhelmed student who had first arrived in Kota. He had developed a strong foundation in physics, chemistry, and mathematics, and more importantly, he had learned the value of hard work, perseverance, and resilience. On twenty fifth May two thousand and twenty six, when the J-E-E results were announced, Rohan secured a rank of three thousand five hundred, securing him a seat in I-I-T Guwahati. His grandfather's words echoed in his mind once again, but this time, they were filled with the sweet taste of success. He knew the journey had been tough, but it had also been transformative. The two point five years in Kota had shaped him in ways he couldn't have imagined.
